bugprone-throw-keyword-missing.description:
Description

Warns about a potentially missing
throw
keyword. If a temporary object
is created, but the object’s type derives from (or is the same as) a class
that has ‘EXCEPTION’, ‘Exception’ or ‘exception’ in its name, we can assume
that the programmer’s intention was to throw that object.

Example:

void
f
(
int
i
)
{
if
(
i
<
0
)
{
// Exception is created but is not thrown.
std
::
runtime_error
(
"Unexpected argument"
);
}
}
bugprone-throw-keyword-missing.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

This rule has no specific options.
